document.heading: Merchant’s Civil Recovery for Criminal Conduct Act of 1992

history.narrative: Law 9-98, the “Merchant’s Civil Recovery for Criminal Conduct Act of 1992,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 19-152, which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on December 3, 1991, and January 7, 1992, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on January 28, 1992, it was assigned Act No. 9-138 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 9-98 became effective on May 16, 1992.
